intro: Hemitelia serra, commonly known as the serrated hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a central yellow stamen. Hemitelia serra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
